jmf.module

Interface IFrameworkAccess

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Core

    public interface IFrameworkAccess
    Interfase to access a ZMF instance from a module Created on 7/25/15.
    Author:
    Tobias Korb, Jonas Grunert, Jan Strau√ü

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void forceStateBroadcast()
      Triggers a state broadcast for the module of this instance.
      IConfigurationProvider getConfigurationProvider()
      Returns the configuration provider interface which allows to access configuration values
      IPeerRegistry getPeerRegistry() 
      void onModuleAdditionalStateChanged(byte[] additionalState)
      Called when the additional state of a module was changed.
      void publish(Message msg)
      Publishes an event to the messaging message bus.
      void requestDisableModule()
      Requests to initiate disabling of the module managed by this ZMF core
      boolean requestDisableRemoteInstance(ModuleUniqueId id, long timeout)
      Requests the remote instance to be disabled.
      boolean requestEnableRemoteInstance(ModuleUniqueId id, long timeout)
      Requests the remote instance to be enabled.
      void requestStopInstance()
      Requests to initiate stopping this ZMF core and its module
      boolean requestStopRemoteInstance(ModuleUniqueId id, long timeout)
      Requests the remote instance to stop.

      Sends a request to a given node and returns a future_ to await the response.

      Starts a subscription to the given topic.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigurationProvider

        IConfigurationProvider getConfigurationProvider()
        Returns the configuration provider interface which allows to access configuration values
        Returns:
        Interface to configuration provider

      • getPeerRegistry

        IPeerRegistry getPeerRegistry()
        Returns:
        The public interface of the PeerRegistry which offers information about all known peers

      • sendRequest

        InReply sendRequest(ModuleUniqueId target,
                    Message msg)
        Sends a request to a given node and returns a future_ to await the response.

      • subscribe

        SubscriptionHandle subscribe(MessageType topic,
                             java.util.function.BiConsumer<Message,ModuleUniqueId> handler)
        Starts a subscription to the given topic. Received subscription events will be sent to the given handler callback.

      • publish

        void publish(Message msg)
        Publishes an event to the messaging message bus.

      • onModuleAdditionalStateChanged

        void onModuleAdditionalStateChanged(byte[] additionalState)
        Called when the additional state of a module was changed. Will not trigger automatically trigger a state broadcast.

      • forceStateBroadcast

        void forceStateBroadcast()
        Triggers a state broadcast for the module of this instance.

      • requestDisableModule

        void requestDisableModule()
        Requests to initiate disabling of the module managed by this ZMF core

      • requestStopInstance

        void requestStopInstance()
        Requests to initiate stopping this ZMF core and its module

      • requestEnableRemoteInstance

        boolean requestEnableRemoteInstance(ModuleUniqueId id,
                                    long timeout)
        Requests the remote instance to be enabled. Will wait for the given timeout (ms) and return true only if a reply was received for the request and if the received reply was positive

      • requestDisableRemoteInstance

        boolean requestDisableRemoteInstance(ModuleUniqueId id,
                                     long timeout)
        Requests the remote instance to be disabled. Will wait for the given timeout (ms) and return true only if a reply was received for the request and if the received reply was positive

      • requestStopRemoteInstance

        boolean requestStopRemoteInstance(ModuleUniqueId id,
                                  long timeout)
        Requests the remote instance to stop. Will wait for the given timeout (ms) and return true only if a reply was received for the request and if the received reply was positive
